Parameters: int: The layout resource ID to be inflated.
setDialogLayoutResource(int).Description: Sets the layout resource that is inflated as the @B_android#view#View_E@ to be shown as the content View of subsequent dialogs.

Parameters: int: The positive button text as a resource.
int: The dialog message as a resource.

getDialogMessage().Description: Returns the message to be shown on subsequent dialogs.

Parameters: int: The icon, as a resource ID.
setDialogIcon(int).Description: Sets the icon (resource ID) of the dialog. This will be shown on subsequent dialogs.

Parameters: CharSequence: The text of the negative button.
setNegativeButtonText(java.lang.CharSequ.Description: Sets the text of the negative button of the dialog. This will be shown on subsequent dialogs.

getDialogLayoutResource().Description: Returns the layout resource that is used as the content View for subsequent dialogs.

getDialogTitle().Description: Returns the title to be shown on subsequent dialogs.

setDialogIcon(android.graphics.drawable..Description: Sets the icon of the dialog. This will be shown on subsequent dialogs.

setDialogTitle(java.lang.CharSequence).Description: Sets the title of the dialog. This will be shown on subsequent dialogs.

onClick().Description: Processes a click on the preference. This includes saving the value to the @B_android#content#SharedPreferences_E@. However, the overridden method should call @B_android#support#v7#preference#Preference#callChangeListener_E@ to make sure the client wants to update the preference's state with the new value.

setDialogMessage(java.lang.CharSequence).Description: Sets the message of the dialog. This will be shown on subsequent dialogs. This message forms the content View of the dialog and conflicts with list-based dialogs, for example. If setting a custom View on a dialog via @B_android#support#v7#preference#DialogPreference#setDialogLayoutResource_E@, include a text View with ID @B_android#R#id#message_E@ and it will be populated with this message.

Parameters: int: The dialog title as a resource.

Returns: The text of the negative button.
getNegativeButtonText().Description: Returns the text of the negative button to be shown on subsequent dialogs.

Returns: The text of the positive button.
getPositiveButtonText().Description: Returns the text of the positive button to be shown on subsequent dialogs.

Parameters: CharSequence: The text of the positive button.
setPositiveButtonText(java.lang.CharSequ.Description: Sets the text of the positive button of the dialog. This will be shown on subsequent dialogs.

Parameters: int: The negative button text as a resource.

getDialogIcon().Description: Returns the icon to be shown on subsequent dialogs.

ClassDesc: A base class for @B_android#support#v7#preference#Preference_E@ objects that are dialog-based. These preferences will, when clicked, open a dialog showing the actual preference controls.
